title: Integrated Child Development Services programme: A 50-year lifeline

But the crucial scheme for early childhood development faces several challenges, especially of fund crunch, says Shilpa Elizabeth

title: Morning Digest: Fire breaks out at COP30 venue in Brazil; Supreme Court opinion on Presidential Reference draws mixed reviews, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Lip-Lock legacy: Humans inherited kissing from apes; origins trace back 21mn years
description: A groundbreaking study reveals kissing predates humans by millions of years, originating with ape ancestors in prehistoric Africa. Researchers define it as non-aggressive mouth-to-mouth contact, observing it across diverse species, particularly primates. This ancient behavior, possibly practiced by Neanderthals, may have evolved for mate assessment or social bonding, offering a glimpse into our deep evolutionary past.

title: Frida Kahlo’s self-portrait sells for $54.7 million, shatters auction record for female artists
description: Some art historians have scrutinised the sale for cultural reasons, while others have raised concern that the painting — last exhibited publicly in the late 1990s — could again disappear from public view after the auction

title: To deter migration, U.K. proposes new rules for settlement
description: Changes to the law, along the proposed lines, will impact tens of thousands of Indians who have been the largest group of non-EU long-term migrants to the U.K. since at least 2019

Pharmacogenomics: reading genes to tailor prescriptions for individuals
description: Unlike traditional medicine’s one-size-fits-all approach, the field of pharmacogenomics recognises that genetic differences can dramatically alter how our bodies metabolise and respond to drugs. It represents a fundamental shift in how we think about drug therapy from treating populations to treating individuals, from reactive care to proactive prevention, from trial-and-error to precision medication

title: IND vs SA: Former India cricketer advises Shubman Gill to take a break - 'Skip the IPL' -
description: India captain Shubman Gill faces a fitness test for the second Test against South Africa after a neck spasm. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra advised Gill to take a break, suggesting skipping the IPL if workload is a concern. Gill has been a central figure, playing all major assignments this year.

title: Indian Test team: 'Not even allowed to fail' - Ex-cricketer questions Sarfaraz Khan's omission
description: Meanwhile, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said Sarfaraz has been affected by a perception issue. Sarfaraz has played six Tests so far, scoring 371 runs at an average of 37.10, with three fifties and one century. ​His highest score in Tests is 150.

title: When Rajaji, Congress legislators of Madras Presidency favoured two-nation theory
description: Amid the Second World War, the Congress Legislature Party convened in Madras on April 23, 1942, at the behest of Rajaji. It passed two resolutions urging the AICC to acknowledge the Muslim League’s claim for Pakistan and allow a government to be formed in the Presidency along with the League. Both proved controversial and failed

title: A living heritage gets a facelift
description: St. George’s Cathedral, established in 1816 on what is now called Cathedral Road in Madras, was recently rededicated after renovation under the supervision of experts of IIT Madras. It is the mother church for the CSI and the Diocese of Madras

title: How a Brahmin woman was elected the Mayor of Madras on DMK ticket in 1971
description: In the communal rotation system that was in place for the post, Kamakshi Jayaraman won the election held on November 29 that year, securing 74 votes as against the 47 votes polled by her nearest rival C.R. Narasimhan of the Swatantra Party. She was a DMK member like her husband. She also became the second woman Mayor of Madras

Genuine WHO-recommended Oral Rehydration Salts, classified as drugs, are exempt from this crackdown.

Acting on intelligence, police intercepted the duo who were tasked by a Pakistan-based handler to exchange grenades. Recoveries included grenades, pistols, and ammunition.

description: Philadelphia faces Boston tonight without star Joel Embiid, sidelined by right knee soreness for a fifth straight game.  The Sixers, also missing Paul George and Kelly Oubre Jr., rely on Andre Drummond and Tyrese Maxey to step up.  The Celtics are also dealing with key absences, including Jayson Tatum, making this a test of depth for both contenders.

John Cena also faces Dominik Mysterio for the Intercontinental Championship. The event will stream on Peacock, ESPN Unlimited, and Netflix.

With key players managing injuries, the game promises a tactical battle, potentially foreshadowing playoff encounters.  Expect standout performances from Justin Edwards and Tyrese Maxey for the Sixers, while Giannis stays sidelined for Miwaukee Bucks.  A nail-biting finish is anticipated.

title: Mind games! Aus Force tells English fans: Wait for instructions… unlike Bairstow
description: Australia's Border Force playfully reignited the Jonny Bairstow stumping controversy ahead of the Ashes, urging English fans to follow instructions at the airport. The Australian Border Force posted a picture of Bairstow’s controversial stumping at Lord’s, which ignited Ashes series of 2023 in England, along with a message aimed at travelling English fans.

No more Russian oil: Reliance stops import; crude to be sourced from other nations
description: Effective November 20, Reliance Industries has transitioned away from importing Russian crude for its Jamnagar export-only refinery. By switching to non-Russian sources, the company is making a statement ahead of tightening EU restrictions. This early action positions Reliance to fully comply with product-import guidelines that are scheduled to come into play by January 2026.

This marks a recurring gesture from Kumar, who has previously shown similar deference to Modi on multiple occasions. The incident occurred shortly after Kumar's swearing-in for his tenth term as chief minister.

This personal milestone follows Mandhana's stellar performance in India's historic World Cup victory.

Self-employment is creating most new jobs in India: What this means for job seekers
description: Self-employment has emerged as the fastest-growing segment in India’s labour market, rising from 23.9 crore in FY18 to 35.8 crore in FY24. It now accounts for over half of India’s total employment, with growth seen across both farm and non-farm sectors. Students and young professionals are exploring opportunities in freelancing, digital services, traditional businesses, and agricultural entrepreneurship. The trend highlights the need for skill development, entrepreneurial preparedness, and supportive policies to sustain independent work as formal jobs grow slowly.

For Bazball, this is the defining series: victory brings vindication, defeat invites its fiercest scrutiny yet.

‘Work will be optional’: Musk outlines AI future; says money may lose relevance
description: Elon Musk forecasts a future where work becomes optional for most people. He believes advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics will transform society. Humanoid robots, like Tesla's Optimus, could become the largest industry. This technological leap may also eliminate poverty and make everyone wealthy. Musk suggests money's relevance could diminish as resources become abundant through automation.

'Intellectual terrorists more dangerous': Cops on Delhi 2020 riots; flag worrying trend
description: Delhi Police informed the Supreme Court that "intellectuals becoming terrorists" pose a greater danger. They argued that activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, among others, are using trial delays to their advantage. The police presented evidence of "inflammatory speeches" and alleged the riots were timed with Donald Trump's visit to spark nationwide unrest and achieve "regime change."

title: Don’t ignore these 5 subtle heart-failure indicators, including cough at night
description: Heart failure often develops subtly, with overlooked symptoms like unexplained weight gain, persistent cough when lying down, digestive issues, confusion, and sleep disturbances. Dr. Dmitry Yaranov stresses that recognizing these early warning signs is crucial for prompt medical care, effective management, and preventing serious complications, ultimately improving long-term heart health and quality of life.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Candace Owens drops explosive claim on Charlie Kirk ‘assassination’
description: Candace Owens questions the official narrative surrounding Charlie Kirk's shooting, suggesting a planned setup involving multiple individuals. She claims Tyler Robinson's role was limited, with his fingerprints not being the only ones on the weapon. Owens also alleges Lance Twiggs played a more significant, albeit different, part in the incident, citing a TMZ video as evidence.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
description: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.
